task_summary: The robot locates and grasps the oven door, then pulls it open and verifies that it is open.

task_long_description.overview: This scenario depicts a robotic manipulator operating in a kitchen-like environment. The main object is the oven door, which the robot must open by first locating it visually, approaching and aligning with it, computing a grasp suitable for pulling, executing the grasp, and then pulling until the door is open. The robot finally verifies success by confirming the oven door is indeed open, and retreats safely. Physical alignment, perception, and gentle actuation are essential for safe manipulation.
stepwise_plan: Check existence and visibility of oven door
Detect oven door if not already visible
Approach and align end effector with oven door handle
Compute grasp pose with pull strategy
success_criteria: Oven door visually and mechanically confirmed open
No collisions or damage to door
Robot safely returns to a neutral position
failure_and_recovery: Failed to grasp: recompute pose and retry
Door stuck/doesn't open: abort, alert operator
task_long_description.termination: Tree terminates when oven door is detected as open and robot has retreated from direct contact.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

node_specs.description: Checks if the oven door is visible to the robot's sensors.
Runs detection algorithm to localize the oven door.
Moves and aligns robot end effector to the oven door handle.
Computes grasp pose for the oven door using a pull strategy.
Executes the grasp at the computed pose.
Pulls the oven door open by 20cm, perpendicular to the door.
Checks if the oven door is open.
Retracts the arm from the oven door.

failure_modes: Oven door not detected by sensors
Failure to grasp oven door handle securely
Oven door fails to open (mechanical jam or collision)
recovery_strategy: Retry detection if oven door not visible
Recompute grasp pose if grasp not stable
Abort and alert if unable to open door after retries
Immediate retreat and halt in case of collision
assumptions: The visual evidence shows side-pull on oven door handle, not a downward or twisting grasp
Instruction matches observed sequence in all frames (no mismatch)
Direction_deg=90 (sideways) inferred from handle orientation in images
Handle is present and accessibleâ€”no obstacles detected

expected_success_criteria: Oven door open and robot disengaged
